title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Proverbs chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Proverbs Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3:5, in whom should you trust with all your heart?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:5 says, 'Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.'

questions.question: What will happen if you honor the LORD with your substance according to Proverbs 3:9-10?
options: Your barns will be filled with plenty
questions.correctAnswer: Your barns will be filled with plenty
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:9-10 explains that honoring the LORD with your substance and firstfruits will fill your barns with plenty and make your presses burst out with new wine.

questions.question: What two qualities should not forsake you according to Proverbs 3:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy and truth
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:3 says, 'Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart.'

questions.question: What does Proverbs 3:6 say about acknowledging God in all your ways?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall direct thy paths
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:6 states, 'In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3:11-12, why should you not despise the chastening of the LORD?
options: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth
questions.correctAnswer: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:11-12 explains that the LORD corrects those He loves like a father corrects his son.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from Proverbs 3:15: 'She is more precious than ______: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.'
questions.correctAnswer: rubies
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:15 says, 'She is more precious than rubies: and all the things thou canst desire are not to be compared unto her.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 3:7 advises being wise in your own eyes.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:7 says, 'Be not wise in thine own eyes: fear the LORD, and depart from evil.' It advises against being wise in your own eyes.

questions.question: What is described as a 'tree of life' to those who lay hold upon her in Proverbs 3:18?
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:18 says, 'She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her,' referring to wisdom.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3:23, what will happen when you walk in your way safely?
questions.correctAnswer: Thy foot shall not stumble
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:23 states, 'Then shalt thou walk in thy way safely, and thy foot shall not stumble.'

questions.question: What does Proverbs 3:27 advise regarding doing good to others?
options: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due
questions.correctAnswer: Withhold not good from them to whom it is due
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:27 says, 'Withhold not good from them to whom it is due, when it is in the power of thine hand to do it.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 3:34 says God gives grace to the proud.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:34 says, 'But he giveth grace unto the lowly,' not the proud.

questions.question: What is the merchandise of wisdom better than, according to Proverbs 3:14?
questions.correctAnswer: Silver and fine gold
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:14 states, 'For the merchandise of it is better than the merchandise of silver, and the gain thereof than fine gold.'

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3:8, what effect does wisdom have on your body?
options: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones
questions.correctAnswer: It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:8 says, 'It shall be health to thy navel, and marrow to thy bones.'

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 3:25 tells us to be afraid of sudden fear and the desolation of the wicked.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:25 says, 'Be not afraid of sudden fear, neither of the desolation of the wicked, when it cometh.'

questions.question: What should you not envy according to Proverbs 3:31?
questions.correctAnswer: The oppressor
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:31 says, 'Envy thou not the oppressor, and choose none of his ways.'

medium.title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Proverbs Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 3 teach us to approach trusting God in difficult times?
options: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; lean not on thine own understanding
Rely only on your own wisdom and plans
Ignore God and focus on worldly success
Wait passively without seeking God's guidance
questions.correctAnswer: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; lean not on thine own understanding
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:5 instructs to trust fully in the LORD and not rely on our own understanding. This is reinforced by verse 3:6, which says God will direct our paths when we acknowledge Him in all our ways. Verses 3:7 and 3:26 further encourage fearing the LORD and having confidence in Him for protection and guidance.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3, what is a benefit of honoring the LORD with your substance and firstfruits?
options: Your barns will be filled with plenty, and your presses shall burst out with new wine
You will become wealthy without effort
questions.correctAnswer: Your barns will be filled with plenty, and your presses shall burst out with new wine
questions.explanation: Verse 3:9 teaches to honor the LORD with your wealth and firstfruits. Verse 3:10 promises that doing so results in abundance, symbolized by barns filled with plenty and presses bursting with new wine. This illustrates God's blessing on faithful stewardship.

questions.question: A fellow believer is discouraged by God's correction. What truth from Proverbs 3 would encourage them?
options: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth
God punishes only the wicked and ignores the righteous
Correction is a sign of God's anger without love
God is distant and uninvolved in our discipline
questions.correctAnswer: For whom the LORD loveth he correcteth; even as a father the son in whom he delighteth
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:11-12 explains that God's correction is a sign of His love, comparable to a father's loving discipline of a child. This encourages believers to accept correction as part of God's care and desire for their growth.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 3 describe the value of wisdom compared to material wealth?
options: Wisdom is more precious than rubies and better than fine gold
Wealth is more valuable than wisdom
Wisdom and wealth are equally important
Wisdom has no value without money
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom is more precious than rubies and better than fine gold
questions.explanation: Verses 3:13-15 emphasize the surpassing value of wisdom and understanding, stating that wisdom's merchandise is better than silver and fine gold, and it is more precious than rubies. This highlights the eternal worth of spiritual understanding over material possessions.

questions.question: What practical advice does Proverbs 3 give about dealing with neighbors and doing good?
options: Withhold not good when it is in your power to do it
Plan evil against neighbors to gain advantage
questions.correctAnswer: Withhold not good when it is in your power to do it
questions.explanation: Verses 3:27-29 instruct believers to not withhold good from those to whom it is due, and to avoid devising evil or strife against neighbors. This teaches integrity, generosity, and peaceful living within the community.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3, what should be the attitude toward one's own wisdom?
options: Be not wise in thine own eyes; fear the LORD and depart from evil
Trust only your own wisdom and reject advice
Consider yourself the wisest in all matters
questions.correctAnswer: Be not wise in thine own eyes; fear the LORD and depart from evil
questions.explanation: Verse 3:7 warns against self-conceit in wisdom, urging reverence for the LORD and turning away from evil. This humility is foundational for spiritual growth and right living.

questions.question: What promises are given in Proverbs 3 about the benefits of keeping God's commandments in your heart?
options: Length of days, long life, and peace
Freedom to do as you please
questions.correctAnswer: Length of days, long life, and peace
questions.explanation: Verse 3:1-2 promises that keeping God's law and commandments in the heart will add length of days, long life, and peace. This highlights the blessings of obedience and devotion.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 3 teaches that God will keep your foot from being taken if you trust in Him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 3:26 states that the LORD will be your confidence and keep your foot from being taken, assuring protection and stability for those who trust Him.

questions.question: What is the significance of mercy and truth according to Proverbs 3?
options: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee; bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart
Mercy and truth are less important than wealth
Only truth is important; mercy can be ignored
Mercy and truth are for the weak
questions.correctAnswer: Let not mercy and truth forsake thee; bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart
questions.explanation: Verse 3:3 commands believers to hold mercy and truth closely and internalize them deeply, indicating their essential role in godly character and relationships.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3, what results from finding wisdom and understanding?
options: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding
Only sorrow and regret come from wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding
questions.explanation: Verse 3:13 states that finding wisdom and understanding brings happiness, which is further supported by verses 3:16-18 describing wisdom's blessings of length of days, riches, honor, pleasantness, peace, and being a tree of life.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: understanding
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:5 specifically commands to trust in the LORD fully and not rely on one's own understanding, highlighting the importance of divine guidance over human reasoning.

questions.question: Why does Proverbs 3 say we should not envy the oppressor or choose any of his ways?
options: Because the froward is an abomination to the LORD
Because envy is a sign of strength
Because choosing their ways leads to power
questions.correctAnswer: Because the froward is an abomination to the LORD
questions.explanation: Verses 3:31-32 warn against envying or imitating oppressors since the froward (perverse) are an abomination to the LORD, whereas His secret is with the righteous. This teaches the value of integrity and righteousness over corrupt gain.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3, what are the ways of wisdom described as?
options: Ways of pleasantness and all her paths are peace
Paths full of hardship and sorrow
questions.correctAnswer: Ways of pleasantness and all her paths are peace
questions.explanation: Verse 3:17 describes wisdom's ways as pleasant and her paths as peace, indicating that following wisdom leads to a peaceful and pleasant life experience.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 3 teaches that the wise shall inherit glory, but fools shall be promoted with shame.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 3:35 clearly states that the wise shall inherit glory, but shame will be the promotion of fools, highlighting the ultimate honor for wisdom and disgrace for foolishness.

questions.question: When you lie down, what promise does Proverbs 3 give about your rest?
options: You shall not be afraid, and your sleep shall be sweet
You will be troubled by worries
Sleep will be restless and anxious
You must work to earn rest
questions.correctAnswer: You shall not be afraid, and your sleep shall be sweet
questions.explanation: Verse 3:24 promises peaceful and sweet sleep without fear to those who follow God's wisdom, illustrating the security found in trusting Him.

hard.title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Proverbs Chapter 3.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3:5, what is the correct posture believers should have toward the LORD?
options: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart
Fear the LORD and depart from evil
Honor the LORD with thy substance
questions.correctAnswer: Trust in the LORD with all thine heart
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:5 instructs believers to 'Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding,' emphasizing dependence on God rather than self.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 3:6 promise will happen if you acknowledge the LORD in all your ways?
options: Thy barns shall be filled with plenty
Thou shalt find favor and good understanding
questions.correctAnswer: He shall direct thy paths
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states, 'In all thy ways acknowledge him, and he shall direct thy paths,' indicating divine guidance upon recognizing God.

questions.question: In Proverbs 3:3, which two qualities are we urged not to forsake and to bind about our neck?
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy and truth
questions.explanation: The verse advises, 'Let not mercy and truth forsake thee: bind them about thy neck; write them upon the table of thine heart,' emphasizing their importance.

questions.question: What is the consequence mentioned in Proverbs 3:4 for keeping mercy and truth in the heart?
options: Finding favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man
Length of days and long life
questions.correctAnswer: Finding favour and good understanding in the sight of God and man
questions.explanation: Verse 4 connects mercy and truth with 'favor and good understanding in the sight of God and man,' highlighting relational blessings.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 3:7 warn against when it says, 'Be not wise in thine own eyes'?
questions.correctAnswer: Pride and self-reliance
questions.explanation: The phrase 'Be not wise in thine own eyes' warns against pride and self-reliance, urging fear of the LORD and turning from evil (verse 7).

questions.question: Proverbs 3:9-10 commands honoring the LORD with what, promising abundance in return?
options: Substance and the firstfruits of all thine increase
questions.correctAnswer: Substance and the firstfruits of all thine increase
questions.explanation: These verses emphasize honoring God with material wealth and firstfruits, promising filled barns and overflowing presses as blessing.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 3:11-12 describe the LORD’s correction of His son?
options: As a loving discipline like a father's correction of a son
questions.correctAnswer: As a loving discipline like a father's correction of a son
questions.explanation: Verse 12 compares God's correction to a father's loving discipline, showing that it is an expression of love and delight.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 3:13 teach about the man who finds wisdom and understanding?
questions.correctAnswer: He is happy
questions.explanation: Verse 13 explicitly states, 'Happy is the man that findeth wisdom, and the man that getteth understanding,' underscoring joy from wisdom.

questions.question: Which metaphor in Proverbs 3:18 describes wisdom’s effect on those who embrace her?
questions.correctAnswer: A tree of life
questions.explanation: Verse 18 calls wisdom 'a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her,' symbolizing vitality and blessing.

questions.question: In the context of ancient Near Eastern culture, what significance does the phrase 'honour the LORD with thy substance' (Proverbs 3:9) convey?
options: Offering firstfruits as an act of covenant loyalty and trust
A ritual sacrifice to appease gods
A legal requirement to avoid punishment
questions.correctAnswer: Offering firstfruits as an act of covenant loyalty and trust
questions.explanation: The firstfruits offering reflected covenant faithfulness and reliance on God’s provision, a practice rooted in Israelite tradition.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 3:19-20 reflect the biblical theme of God’s wisdom in creation compared to Genesis 1?
options: It attributes the earth’s foundation and heavens’ establishment to divine wisdom and understanding
It describes creation as chaotic and unplanned
It emphasizes human creativity over divine action
It ignores creation and focuses on human morality
questions.correctAnswer: It attributes the earth’s foundation and heavens’ establishment to divine wisdom and understanding
questions.explanation: These verses echo Genesis 1 by highlighting God’s wisdom as the foundation of creation, emphasizing order and knowledge.

questions.question: What literary device is employed in Proverbs 3:3-4 with the repetition of qualities like mercy and truth and their effects?
questions.correctAnswer: Parallelism
questions.explanation: The couplet pairs mercy and truth with their positive outcomes, illustrating synonymous parallelism common in Hebrew poetry.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 3:35 contrasts the destiny of the wise and the fools by stating that fools shall inherit glory.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:35 states, 'The wise shall inherit glory: but shame shall be the promotion of fools,' making clear that fools face shame, not glory.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3:27-28, what ethical behavior is emphasized regarding neighbors?
options: Do not withhold good when it is in your power to do it
Seek to outdo your neighbor in wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Do not withhold good when it is in your power to do it
questions.explanation: Verses 27-28 instruct not to delay doing good to neighbors when able, promoting generosity and timely kindness.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'length of days is in her right hand' in Proverbs 3:16 when referring to wisdom?
options: It symbolizes that wisdom grants long life and prosperity
It refers to a literal physical attribute
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes that wisdom grants long life and prosperity
questions.explanation: The phrase metaphorically assigns to wisdom the power to provide longevity and honor, reflecting ancient Near Eastern symbolic language.

theological.title: Proverbs Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Proverbs Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3:5-6, what is the proper posture of the believer in trusting God?
options: Trust in the LORD with all your heart and do not lean on your own understanding
Trust in your own wisdom and lean on your understanding
Acknowledge God only when times are difficult
Trust partially in God and partially in your own plans
questions.correctAnswer: Trust in the LORD with all your heart and do not lean on your own understanding
questions.explanation: Proverbs 3:5-6 commands total trust in the LORD and not relying on one’s own understanding, promising that God will direct one’s paths. This is consistent with Jeremiah 17:7, Psalm 37:5, Isaiah 26:4, and Jesus' teaching in John 14:1 about trusting God wholeheartedly.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 3:9-10 teach about the relationship between honoring God and material blessings?
options: Honoring God with your substance and firstfruits leads to barns filled with plenty and presses bursting with new wine
Material blessings come regardless of honoring God
Honor God only with your time, not your possessions
Material blessings are guaranteed without honoring God
questions.correctAnswer: Honoring God with your substance and firstfruits leads to barns filled with plenty and presses bursting with new wine
questions.explanation: The passage teaches that honoring God with one’s wealth and firstfruits results in abundance (Proverbs 3:9-10). This aligns with Malachi 3:10, 2 Corinthians 9:6-8, Luke 6:38, and Psalm 112:3, illustrating God’s blessing on faithful giving.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 3:11-12 describe the purpose of God's correction?
options: God corrects those He loves, like a father disciplines a son in whom he delights
God corrects only the wicked to punish them
Correction is arbitrary and without purpose
God’s correction is a sign of His displeasure without love
questions.correctAnswer: God corrects those He loves, like a father disciplines a son in whom he delights
questions.explanation: These verses reveal that divine discipline is an expression of God’s love and delight in His people, paralleling Hebrews 12:6, Revelation 3:19, Psalm 94:12, and Job 5:17, emphasizing God’s paternal care in correction.

questions.question: What is the value of wisdom according to Proverbs 3:13-15?
options: Wisdom is more precious than rubies and better than silver or gold
Wisdom is less valuable than material wealth
Wisdom is only for the old and wise
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom is more precious than rubies and better than silver or gold
questions.explanation: The passage extols wisdom’s incomparable value over earthly riches, consistent with Job 28:18, Ecclesiastes 7:12, James 3:17, and Matthew 13:44 where wisdom and the kingdom of heaven are portrayed as precious treasures.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3:17-18, what are the characteristics and benefits of wisdom’s ways?
options: Wisdom’s ways are pleasantness and peace, and she is a tree of life to those who hold her
Wisdom’s ways are harsh and burdensome
Wisdom offers no peace or joy
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom’s ways are pleasantness and peace, and she is a tree of life to those who hold her
questions.explanation: Wisdom produces pleasant and peaceful paths and is life-giving, echoing themes in Psalm 1:3, Jeremiah 17:7-8, Proverbs 11:30, and Revelation 22:2 where life and blessing are linked to wisdom and the tree of life imagery.

questions.question: What theological truth about God's creation is taught in Proverbs 3:19-20?
options: The LORD founded the earth by wisdom and established the heavens by understanding
The earth and heavens came about by chance
Creation was formed without divine knowledge
The LORD’s knowledge is limited in creation
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD founded the earth by wisdom and established the heavens by understanding
questions.explanation: This affirms God’s wisdom and understanding as the foundation of creation, consistent with Job 38:4-7, Psalm 104:24, Colossians 1:16, and John 1:3, emphasizing God’s sovereignty and wisdom in creation.

questions.question: What promise is given in Proverbs 3:23-24 concerning the believer’s safety and rest?
options: You will walk safely without stumbling and lie down without fear, enjoying sweet sleep
You will face constant danger and restless nights
Safety depends solely on human effort
Rest is not guaranteed for the righteous
questions.correctAnswer: You will walk safely without stumbling and lie down without fear, enjoying sweet sleep
questions.explanation: This promise assures divine protection and peace, similar to Psalm 4:8, Isaiah 26:3, Matthew 11:28-30, and John 14:27, highlighting God’s care for the believer’s well-being and rest.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 3:27-28, what attitude should the believer have toward doing good to others?
options: Do not withhold good when it is in your power to do so, and do not delay helping your neighbor
Only help others when it benefits you
It is wise to say ‘come again tomorrow’ when you can help now
Ignore the needs of your neighbor
questions.correctAnswer: Do not withhold good when it is in your power to do so, and do not delay helping your neighbor
questions.explanation: These verses command prompt and willing generosity, resonating with Luke 10:30-37, Hebrews 13:16, Galatians 6:10, and James 2:15-17, emphasizing active love and care for others.

questions.question: What warning is given in Proverbs 3:30 regarding interpersonal conflict?
options: Do not strive with a man without cause if he has done you no harm
Avoid all conflict at any cost
questions.correctAnswer: Do not strive with a man without cause if he has done you no harm
questions.explanation: This teaching promotes peace and restraint, consistent with Matthew 5:9, Romans 12:17-21, Ephesians 4:31-32, and James 1:19, instructing believers to avoid unnecessary quarrels.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 3:31-32 teach about the Lord’s attitude toward the wicked versus the righteous?
options: The LORD detests the froward but keeps his secret with the righteous
The LORD favors the wicked over the righteous
The LORD is indifferent to human behavior
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD detests the froward but keeps his secret with the righteous
questions.explanation: This contrasts God’s rejection of the crooked with His special favor toward the righteous, paralleling Psalm 5:5, Proverbs 15:9, Isaiah 59:2, and Romans 1:18, underscoring divine holiness and covenant fellowship.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 3:33-34 describe the consequences for the wicked and the humble before God?
options: The curse of the LORD is on the wicked’s house, but He blesses the habitation of the just and gives grace to the lowly
The wicked receive blessings and the humble are scorned
The humble receive curses and the proud receive grace
questions.correctAnswer: The curse of the LORD is on the wicked’s house, but He blesses the habitation of the just and gives grace to the lowly
questions.explanation: This highlights God’s justice and grace — cursing the wicked and blessing the righteous and humble, consistent with Psalm 34:18, James 4:6, Matthew 5:5, and Galatians 6:7.

questions.question: What is the ultimate destiny contrast between the wise and fools according to Proverbs 3:35?
options: The wise shall inherit glory, but shame is the promotion of fools
Both wise and fools receive the same reward
Fools will be honored and the wise will be ashamed
Destiny depends on luck, not wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: The wise shall inherit glory, but shame is the promotion of fools
questions.explanation: This verse teaches the final honor for the wise and disgrace for fools, paralleling Psalm 1:5-6, Daniel 12:3, Matthew 25:21, and 1 Corinthians 1:18, emphasizing divine judgment aligned with wisdom and folly.

questions.question: In Proverbs 3:3-4, what qualities should not be forsaken and are to be written on the heart?
questions.correctAnswer: Mercy and truth
questions.explanation: Mercy and truth are to be preserved and internalized, reflecting God’s covenant love as seen in Micah 6:8, Psalm 89:14, John 1:14, and Ephesians 4:25, highlighting ethical virtues essential for favor with God and man.

questions.question: What is the effect of fearing the LORD and departing from evil as stated in Proverbs 3:7-8?
options: It brings health to your body and nourishment to your bones
It leads to confusion and weakness
questions.correctAnswer: It brings health to your body and nourishment to your bones
questions.explanation: Fearing God and turning from evil results in holistic well-being, reflecting the biblical connection between spiritual obedience and physical blessing seen in Psalm 34:19, Isaiah 58:11, 3 John 1:2, and James 5:14.

questions.question: Proverbs 3:21-22 advises to keep sound wisdom and discretion. What is the promised result of this?
options: They will be life to your soul and grace to your neck
They will bring only temporary success
They will cause hardship and sorrow
They are insignificant to your journey
questions.correctAnswer: They will be life to your soul and grace to your neck
questions.explanation: Maintaining wisdom and discretion brings spiritual vitality and honor, consistent with Proverbs 4:7, Psalm 19:7, James 1:5, and Colossians 3:16, emphasizing the sustaining power of godly wisdom.
